summary: The Department of Justice's Inspector General has found instances of potential fraud, waste, and abuse in programs of DOJ's Office of Juvenile Justice and Delinquency Prevention. This office awarded nearly $874 million in grants from FY 2017-2019. DOJ assigns a risk score to each grant to help determine a monitoring priority—high, medium, or low. title: Juvenile Justice Grants: The Office of Justice Programs Could Improve the Quality of a Key Fraud Control
